item.title: Current course
item.description: ECONOMETRICS Material for Introduction to Econometrics, ECON-466. Spring, 2019. [MyCourses (Blackboard)]](http://mycourses.binghamton.edu). Final Part: Slides for Intro to Causal Inference

item.title: Teaching Experience
item.description: ECONOMETRICS $$y_i=\beta_0+\beta_1x_1+\ldots+\beta_kx_k+u_i$$ State University of New York at Binghamton, USA Instructor. Introduction to Econometrics, ECON-466. Spring, 2019. Undergraduate-level. Textbooks: Wooldridge and Stock and Watson. Syllabus available here. Teaching Evaluations not available yet. Guest lecture. Econometrics, ECON-616, Ph.D. core. Spring 2018. Teaching Assistant. Econometrics. Instructor: Subal Kumbhakar. Ph.D. core (Spring 2018, Spring 2017) and undergraduate (Spring 2019). Universidad Santo Tomás, Chile Instructor Econometrics, ICO-084, undergraduate-level.
